3.8 Summary

The philosophy of animal minds is a rich and growing area of
philosophy. Philosophers engage with the science of animal cognition
to analyze the methods, assumptions, and values in the science itself.
Philosophers also use the research findings to support theories in
traditional topics in metaphysics, epistemology, philosophy of mind,
language and action, and value theory. Finally, attention to animal
cognition can also highlight previously overlooked philosophical
issues related to the nature of culture, learning, and teaching, and
it provides a new lens to consider classic questions about human
nature and our place among all the other animals.
